div.head: CHAP. LXIV.
1 Dauid prayeth for deliuerance, complaining of his enemies. 7 He promiseth himselfe to see such an euident destruction of his enemies, as the righteous shall reioyce at it.
div.ab: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked: from the insurrection of the workers of iniquitie:
Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bowes to shoote their arrowes, euen bitter words: Psal.11.3.
That they may shoote in secret at the perfect: suddenly doe they shoote at him, and feare not.
They incourage themselues in an euill matter: they commune of laying snares priuily; they say, Who shall see them? Or, speech. , Heb. to hide snares.

They search out iniquities, they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of euery one of them, and the heart, is deepe. Or, we are confirmed by that which they haue throughly searched. , Heb. a search, searched.
But God shall shoote at them: with an arrowe, sodenly shall they be wounded. Heb. their wound shalbe.
So they shall make their owne tongue to fall vpon themselues: all that see them, shall flee away.
And all men shall feare, and shall declare the worke of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
The righteous shalbe glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the vpright in heart shall glory.
